text: one-pot meals don't get any easier than
when they're made in a slow cooker
basically everything goes in hours later
everything comes out and you have one
fantastic meal today I'm making a spicy
turkey and black bean chili all in my
slow cooker start off by dicing 1 medium
onion the slow cooker that I'm using
today has a black cooker insert which
actually helps the liquids in it reduce
a little bit more and become more
intense in flavor which I really like
everything can just go right into your
slow cooker so add your onion to the
slow cooker 3 cloves of garlic those
have to be minced as well the lawn
cooking that happens in the slow cooker
happens at a very low temperature and it
allows the flavors to really meld
together for people who go out and work
all day long it's kind of amazing to
come home to a cooked meal add your
garlic to the pot then add your turkey
this is one and a half pounds of
boneless skinless turkey I prefer the
dark meat because I think that it comes
out juicier and over the long slow
cooking that's actually really important
one chili pepper this is a jalapeno
that's been seeded and very finely diced
one chipotle pepper 2 tablespoons of
chili powder 1 can of whole peeled
tomatoes with their juice pureed I
really do prefer the flavor of the whole
peeled tomatoes over the crush so if you
can only get question that's what you
want to use that's okay but I recommend
trying to get whole peeled tomatoes and
then puree them in your food processor
and then a teaspoon of coarse salt stir
everything together cover it up turn it
to high and cook it for three hours
before you're gonna add your beans three
hours later you can add your beans this
is 2 cans of black beans any beans will
do and they can go into your chili stir
them in and then cover it back up keep
it cooking on high for another 30
minutes or until the beans are heated
through
I like chili because it's served with
lots of condiments this is really
satisfying a nice seme ball I know it's
a little early in the fall but you might
as well get ready because you're gonna
be making this one all year long I think
put a little bit of cilantro on top
I want Chile's because I like extra
spice a little bit of sour cream or just
add a little bit of creaminess and then
maybe some tortilla chips to go with it
that is one satisfying meal and I'm not
kidding
it was barely any work use your slow
